item.name: V4 - CURRENT
Sign-in with API Key & API Secret

request.description:
With this endpoint you can obtain an Access Token, which is required to access secured endpoints. To do so, you have to provide both an API Key and an API Secret.

They can be generated on [https://product.early.app](https://product.early.app) or, if you have an Access Token already, with a `POST` request to `/developer/api-access`.

If you have an Access Token, you need to set the `Authorization` Header in every secured request to `Bearer your_access_token`.

With this endpoint you can fetch your API Key. If you haven't generated one yet, `null` will be returned.

 You cannot obtain an API Secret in this way, since it’s visible only once right after generation. If you have lost your API Secret, please generate a new pair of API Key & API Secret.

item.name: Generate new API Key & API Secret

request.description:
With this endpoint you can generate a new pair of API Key & API Secret.

Every time you generate a new pair, the old one becomes invalid. Your API Secret won’t be accessible later, so please note it down in some secret place. If you have lost your API Secret, you can generate a new pair of API Key & API Secret here.
With this endpoint you are invalidating the current Access Token meaning all access wil be denied if you are using it afterwards again.

item.name: Activities

request.description: With this endpoint you can create a new Activity. It should have a name, a folder and a color. The name doesn’t have to be unique.

response.name: Not Folder Admin
OK

item.description:
Activities are one of the main concepts in EARLY. You can track time on them and synchronize them with third party tools, such as JIRA.

When an activity is no longer needed, you can archive it. The data already tracked on it will remain, even if an activity is archived.

item.name: Current Tracking

request.description:
With this endpoint you can set/edit/remove the note of your current Tracking.

To remove the note set it to null/empty/blank. You can provide one or more Tags and Mentions in a note, each of them prefixed with # or @. If the related activity is bound to some Integration, let’s say a JIRA Project, JIRA task IDs are valid Mentions too.

response.name: There is no Tracking or Tracking for another Activity is ongoing

request.description:
With this endpoint you can create a new Time Entry by stopping the current tracking. The resulting Time Entry should have a duration no shorter than 1 minute.

The time entry will be created even if it overlaps with other Time Entries – in result existing Time Entries will be split or deleted in such manner, that the new one will fit without overlapping.

response.name: Created Time Entry

request.description: With this endpoint you can cancel your current Tracking. New Time Entry won't be created.

item.description: A tracking is the representation of what you are doing at any given moment. When finished, a new Time Entry is created based on the tracked time. All timestamps are in the format 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS' in UTC, eg. '2017-12-31T23:59:59.999'.

item.name: Time Entries
Find Time Entries in given range

request.description: Find Time Entries within the given time range.

response.name: OK

request.description:
With this endpoint, you can create a new Time Entry. It should be connected to an Activity and have a duration no shorter than 1 minute. A Note can be provided too, but it’s not required. Within this Note, you can refer one or more Tags or Mentions.

These Tags and Mentions need to be referenced by their ID and put inside a special prefix and suffix, `<{{|t|1|}}>` for the tag with id 1 and `<{{|m|1|}}>` for the mention with id 1.

If the related Activity is bound to some Integration, let’s say a JIRA Project, JIRA task IDs is a valid Mention. The Time Entry will be created even if it overlaps with other Time Entries – in result existing Time Entries will be split or deleted in such manner, that new one will fit without overlapping.

response.name: Integration-related error, eg. if new Time Entry somehow conflicts with data on the Integration side

item.name: Find Time Entry by its ID

request.description:
With this endpoint you can edit an existing time entry. When changing the activity ID please note, that both the new and old activity attached to time entry have to belong to same integration.

To remove a note, just set the complete object to null and all values within the object will be deleted too.

response.name: Activity or Time Entry not found
Integration-related error, eg. if given integration does not exist
OK

item.description:
Time Entries are one of the main concepts in EARLY.

They represent time spent on activities. A time entry can contain a textual Note, which allows you to add some useful context.

There can be only one Time Entry in any given time-frame, even if they belong to different activities. All timestamps are in the format 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS' in UTC, eg. '2017-12-31T23:59:59.999'.

This set of endpoints allows to manage only your own Time Entries. To see Time Entries of your team members, use `POST report` endpoint.

request.description:
Generates a report which contains all the Time Entries from inside the given time range. If some Time Entry exceeds the report’s time range, only the matching part will be included.

Only Members with **Full access** can see Time Entries of other Members of a Folder.

Due to [midnight delay ](https://support.early.app/en/articles/3757577-how-the-midnight-delay-works-with-folders) Members with **Full access** are able to see all time entries created up until midnight in the time entry creator's time zone. You always see your own time entries without delay.

_Warning: For file type "xlsx" or "csv" you need a pro subscription!_

There are 2 mandatory fields:

- date
    
    - start - "YYYY-MM-DD", (e.g. 2024-07-01)
        
    - end - "YYYY-MM-DD", (e.g. 2024-07-31)
        
- fileType ("json", "xlsx" or "csv" )
    

And optional fields that allow you to filter the results:

- activities
    
    - ids (e.g. \["1", "2"\])
        
    - status ("active" or "archived")
        
- users
    
    - ids (e.g. \["1", "2"\])
        
- folders
    
    - ids (e.g. \["1", "2"\])
        
    - status ("active" or "archived")
        
- tags
    
    - ids (e.g. \[1, 2\])
        
- mentions
    
    - ids (e.g. \[1, 2\])
        
- operator ("AND" or "OR") - show Time Entries matching all ("AND") or any ("OR") provided Tags and Mentions, defaults to "OR"
    
- noteQuery (e.g. "text")

item.name: Tags & Mentions

request.description: Fetches all Tags and Mentions, including from third party integrations, such as JIRA, Toggl etc.
Creates a Tag within the given Folder and scope (timeular is default).
Deletes the given tag, returning the list of timeEntries, which were edited by this operation, as well as if the currentTracking was edited by deleting the tag.
Creates a Mention within the given Folder and scope (timeular is default).
Deletes the given mention, returning the list of timeEntries, which were edited by this operation, as well as if the currentTracking was edited by deleting the mention.

item.description: Tags and Mentions are a concept for adding contextual information to time entries. You can add #tags and @mentions to a time entry's note.

request.description: An endpoint for fetching your basic profile information.
An endpoint for fetching basic information about your team members.

item.name: Members
Find Folder Member by their ID

request.description:
An endpoint to show information about Folder Member.

You can use `GET users` endpoint to find IDs of all of your team members.

Access level is "full" or "personal". **Full access** members can do things like create and edit activities and tags within a Folder. **Personal access** members are able to track time entries using the activities and tags that the **Full access** members have created. [Learn more](https://support.early.app/en/articles/3757567-how-to-create-and-setup-folders) about access levels.

With this endpoint you can add a new Member to an existing Folder. You should identify new Member by email and set their access level to "full" or "personal".

Team members with a [subscription seat](https://support.early.app/en/articles/1770789-how-to-assign-a-team-subscription-seat) are immediately added to Folder.

Users without a subscription seat or without a EARLY account receive an invitation email and their "id" in response body has value "pending". They will appear with a **Guest** badge in the Members list.

response.name: No Subscription Seat

request.description: With this endpoint you can remove a Member from Folder. Member who was removed from Folder will be returned in `retiredMembers` response field in Folder endpoints. Removing a Member can take a few minutes.

item.description: A set of endpoints to manage Folder Members.

response.name: List of Folders

request.description:
With this endpoint you can create a new Folder. It should have a name, but the name doesn’t have to be unique.

If you don't want a new Folder to become a [Workspace Folder](https://support.early.app/en/articles/9014818-what-is-a-workspace-folder), add an optional field `isWorkspaceFolder: false` (defaults to `true`).
With this endpoint you can edit a name of an existing Folder.

When a Folder is no longer needed, you can archive it. It will not be possible to edit the Folder settings or add new Members. All folder Activities, Tags and Mentions will be archived. Unlike deleting a Folder, archiving can be undone.
Undo archiving a Folder. All folder Activities, Tags and Mentions will be unarchived.
With this endpoint you can delete existing Folder. Deleting a Folder is NOT reversible and cannot be undone. You may consider archiving a Folder instead. Deletion can take a few minutes.

item.name: Leaves

query.description: Optional. Filter for Leaves of a user. When not provided Leaves of all users are returned. [Requires Admin or Owner role.](https://support.early.app/en/articles/1770789-how-to-assign-a-team-subscription-seat)

request.description: With this endpoint you can list all your Leaves. If you are [Admin or Owner](https://support.early.app/en/articles/1770789-how-to-assign-a-team-subscription-seat) you can list Leaves of all your Team members or just one of them using `userId` param.

response.name: List of Leaves

query.description: Optional. Filter for Leaves of a user. When not provided Leaves of all users are returned. [Requires Admin or Owner role.](https://support.early.app/en/articles/1770789-how-to-assign-a-team-subscription-seat)

Optional. Filter for Leaves of a user. When not provided Leaves of all users are returned. [Requires Admin or Owner role.](https://support.early.app/en/articles/1770789-how-to-assign-a-team-subscription-seat)

request.description: With this endpoint you can list Leave types. Other Leave requests use `typeId` to indicate their type.

response.name: List of Leave Types

request.description:
Create a Leave for yourself. If the Leave exceeds working hours for that day, it will be expanded into a full-day leave.

To create a Leave on behalf of a Team member use [Create a Leave for User endpoint](https://developers.early.app) instead.

`typeId`, `startDate` and `endDate` fields are required.

`note` field is optional.

Create an `approved` Leave on behalf of a Team member. Requires [Admin or Owner role.](https://support.early.app/en/articles/1770789-how-to-assign-a-team-subscription-seat)

If the Leave exceeds Team member's working hours for that day, it will be expanded into a full-day leave.

`typeId`, `startDate` and `endDate` fields are required.

`note` field is optional.

Approve a Leave of Team member. Requires [Admin or Owner role.](https://support.early.app/en/articles/1770789-how-to-assign-a-team-subscription-seat)

Future Leave can be approved regardless of its status, so it's possible to change status of a future Leave from `denied` to `approved` using this endpoint. Only `pending` past Leave can be approved.

response.name: Bad Request

request.description:
Deny a Leave of Team member. Requires [Admin or Owner role.](https://support.early.app/en/articles/1770789-how-to-assign-a-team-subscription-seat)

Future Leave can be denied regardless of its status, so it's possible to change status of a future Leave from `approved` to `denied` using this endpoint. Only `pending` past Leave can be denied.

response.name: Bad Request

request.description:
Delete a Leave. If it's a Leave of another Team member, action requires [Admin or Owner role.](https://support.early.app/en/articles/1770789-how-to-assign-a-team-subscription-seat)

This is an irreversible action. If you want to deny a Leave use [Deny a Leave endpoint](https://developers.early.app/) instead.

item.description: Set of endpoints to manage [Leaves](https://support.early.app/en/articles/8258135-leave-tracking). Leave can be `pending`, `approved` or `denied`.

item.name: Webhooks

request.description: Returns a list of events, which can be subscribed to.

Creates a webhook subscription for the given event. That means that if the event happens (e.g. a time entry is created), the given target url will be called with the payload of the event.

The URL needs to be a valid, publicly reachable, HTTPS URL.

The webhook has a timeout of 10 seconds, so if it takes longer to call the given URL, it will fail.

If the given target URL returns a `410 GONE` error, this webhook subscription will automatically be unsubscribed.

See the Webhooks description for further information about the payloads.

response.name: Maximum Number of Subscriptions per Event

request.description: Removes a webhook subscription by id.

response.name: Subscription not found

request.description: Lists all webhook subscriptions for the current user.
Removes all webhooks subscriptions for the current user.

item.description:
Welcome to the documentation of EARLY Public API v4.

Most of the endpoints are secured.

In order to access them you have to provide an Access Token. To obtain an Access Token, you have to sign-in with a pair of API Key and API Secret first. API Key & API Secret can be generated on [https://product.early.app](https://product.early.app).

If you have any questions, please visit [https://support.early.app](https://support.early.app).

Happy API browsing!

item.name: V3
Sign-in with API Key & API Secret

request.description:
With this endpoint you can obtain an Access Token, which is required to access secured endpoints. To do so, you have to provide both an API Key and an API Secret.

They can be generated on [https://product.early.app](https://product.early.app) or, if you have an Access Token already, with a `POST` request to `/developer/api-access`.

If you have an Access Token, you need to set the `Authorization` Header in every secured request to `Bearer your_access_token`.

With this endpoint you can fetch your API Key. If you haven't generated one yet, `null` will be returned.

 You cannot obtain an API Secret in this way, since it’s visible only once right after generation. If you have lost your API Secret, please generate a new pair of API Key & API Secret.

item.name: Generate new API Key & API Secret

request.description:
With this endpoint you can generate a new pair of API Key & API Secret.

Every time you generate a new pair, the old one becomes invalid. Your API Secret won’t be accessible later, so please note it down in some secret place. If you have lost your API Secret, you can generate a new pair of API Key & API Secret here.
With this endpoint you are invalidating the current Access Token meaning all access wil be denied if you are using it afterwards again.

item.name: Integrations

request.description: With this endpoint you can list the names of all Integrations you have enabled on [https://product.early.app](https://product.early.app)

item.description: Your EARLY account can be connected with Integrations, eg. JIRA. Check them out on [https://product.early.app/#/settings/integrations](https://product.early.app/#/settings/integrations).

item.name: Activities

request.description:
With this endpoint you can create a new Activity. It should have a name, a space and a color.

The name doesn’t have to be unique. You can also provide an Integration to which the activity will belong (zei by default, which means no special Integration). You can obtain a list of enabled Integrations by making a GET request to /api/v3/integrations.

response.name: Integration-related error, eg. if given integration does not exist
Not Space Admin
OK

item.name: Assign an Activity to Device Side

request.description:
With this endpoint you can assign an activity to any Side of your active Device. We do not know how many Sides your Device has and which ones are valid (the default Tracker has 8 sides numbered from 1 to 8). 

In order to activate your Device, make a POST request to /api/v3/devices/{deviceSerial}/activate.

item.name: Unassign an Activity from a Device Side

request.description: With this endpoint, you can delete an assignment of an Activity from a Side of your active Device. In order to activate one proper Device, make a POST request to /api/v3/devices/{deviceSerial}/activate.

response.name: No Device is Active or Activity is not assigned to given Device Side

item.description:
Activities are one of the main concepts in EARLY. You can track time on them and synchronize them with third party tools, such as JIRA.

When an activity is no longer needed, you can archive it. The data already tracked on it will remain, even if an activity is archived.

item.name: Devices

response.name: Device is not known. Make it Active to make it known too.
Device does not have the status Active.

request.description: With this endpoint you can set the name of your device. The name is trimmed from leading and trailing whitespaces. You can remove the name from a Device by setting it to null/blank/empty.

response.name: Device is not known. Make it Active to make it known too.

request.description: With this endpoint, you can remove a Device from the list of known Devices. In order to remove the Device, you have to make it active again with a POST request to /api/v3/devices/{deviceSerial}/activate.

response.name: Device is not known. Make it Active to make it known too.
Device is not known. Make it Active to make it known too.
Device is not known. Make it Active to make it known too.

item.description:
The device represents your Tracker. At the very beginning EARLY knows nothing about your Devices, but you can activate any Device by providing its Serial number.

Only one Device can be active at any given moment, to ensure the EARLY client can perform actions in context of same paired Tracker.

Moreover you can name your Devices to distinguish them easily. Devices can be marked as disabled too, which can help you to see which Devices should not handle Side changes (until enabled again).

item.name: Current Tracking

request.description:
With this endpoint you can set/edit/remove the note of your current Tracking.

To remove the note set it to null/empty/blank. You can provide one or more Tags and Mentions in a note, each of them prefixed with # or @. If the related activity is bound to some Integration, let’s say a JIRA Project, JIRA task IDs are valid Mentions too.

response.name: There is no Tracking or Tracking for another Activity is ongoing

request.description:
With this endpoint you can create a new Time Entry by stopping the current tracking. The resulting Time Entry should have a duration no shorter than 1 minute.

The time entry will be created even if it overlaps with other Time Entries – in result existing Time Entries will be split or deleted in such manner, that the new one will fit without overlapping.

response.name: Created Time Entry

item.description: A tracking is the representation of what you are doing at any given moment. When finished, a new Time Entry is created based on the tracked time. All timestamps are in the format 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS' in UTC, eg. '2017-12-31T23:59:59.999'.

item.name: Time Entries
Find Time Entries in given range

request.description: Find Time Entries within the given time range.

response.name: OK

request.description:
With this endpoint, you can create a new Time Entry. It should be connected to an Activity and have a duration no shorter than 1 minute. A Note can be provided too, but it’s not required. Within this Note, you can refer one or more Tags or Mentions.

These Tags and Mentions need to be referenced by their ID and put inside a special prefix and suffix, `<{{|t|1|}}>` for the tag with id 1 and `<{{|m|1|}}>` for the mention with id 1.

If the related Activity is bound to some Integration, let’s say a JIRA Project, JIRA task IDs is a valid Mention. The Time Entry will be created even if it overlaps with other Time Entries – in result existing Time Entries will be split or deleted in such manner, that new one will fit without overlapping.

response.name: Integration-related error, eg. if new Time Entry somehow conflicts with data on the Integration side

item.name: Find Time Entry by its ID

request.description:
With this endpoint you can edit an existing time entry. When changing the activity ID please note, that both the new and old activity attached to time entry have to belong to same integration.

To remove a note, just set the complete object to null and all values within the object will be deleted too.

response.name: Activity or Time Entry not found
Integration-related error, eg. if given integration does not exist
OK

item.description:
Time Entries are one of the main concepts in EARLY.

They represent time spent on activities. A time entry can contain a textual Note, which allows you to add some useful context.

There can be only one Time Entry in any given time-frame, even if they belong to different activities. All timestamps are in the format 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS' in UTC, eg. '2017-12-31T23:59:59.999'.

request.description:
Generates a report which contains all the Time Entries from inside the given time range. If some Time Entry exceeds the report’s time range, only the matching part will be included.

*Warning: For this endpoint you need a pro subscription!*

There are three optional query parameters:

* activityId (e.g. 1)
* noteQuery (e.g. "sometext")
* fileType ("xlsx" or "csv" - defaults to "csv")

And one mandatory parameter:

* timezone (e.g. Europe/Warsaw)

response.name: Report in CSV or XLSX format

request.description: Generates a Report which contains all the Time Entries from inside the given time range as JSON from all personal spaces and shared spaces. If some Time Entry exceeds the report’s time range, only matching part will be included.

item.name: Tags & Mentions

request.description: Fetches all Tags and Mentions, including from third party integrations, such as JIRA, Toggl etc.
Creates a Tag within the given space and scope (timeular is default).
Deletes the given tag, returning the list of timeEntries, which were edited by this operation, as well as if the currentTracking was edited by deleting the tag.
Creates a Mention within the given space and scope (timeular is default).
Deletes the given mention, returning the list of timeEntries, which were edited by this operation, as well as if the currentTracking was edited by deleting the mention.

item.description: Tags and Mentions are a concept for adding contextual information to time entries. You can add #tags and @mentions to a time entry's note.

request.description: An endpoint for fetching your basic profile information.

Fetches the personal and shared spaces for the current user, with the members and retired members for these spaces.

You will only get other members and retired members for spaces you are admin of, otherwise you will get the space admins and yourself as a member in the response.

response.name: List Spaces with Members

item.name: Webhooks

request.description: Returns a list of events, which can be subscribed to.

Creates a webhook subscription for the given event. That means that if the event happens (e.g. a time entry is created), the given target url will be called with the payload of the event.

The URL needs to be a valid, publicly reachable, HTTPS URL.

The webhook has a timeout of 10 seconds, so if it takes longer to call the given URL, it will fail.

If the given target URL returns a `410 GONE` error, this webhook subscription will automatically be unsubscribed.

See the Webhooks description for further information about the payloads.

response.name: Maximum Number of Subscriptions per Event

request.description: Removes a webhook subscription by id.

response.name: Subscription not found

request.description: Lists all webhook subscriptions for the current user.
Removes all webhooks subscriptions for the current user.

item.description:
**WARNING: This is not the latest version of the API. Please use the latest version.**

Welcome to the documentation of EARLY Public API v3.

Most of the endpoints are secured.

In order to access them you have to provide an Access Token. To obtain an Access Token, you have to sign-in with a pair of API Key and API Secret first. API Key & API Secret can be generated on [https://product.early.app](https://product.early.app).

If you have any questions, please visit [https://support.early.app](https://support.early.app).

Happy API browsing!

item.name: V2
Sign-in with API Key & API Secret

request.description:
With this endpoint you can obtain an Access Token, which is required to access secured endpoints. To do so, you have to provide both an API Key and an API Secret.

They can be generated on [https://product.early.app](https://product.early.app) or, if you have an Access Token already, with a `POST` request to `/developer/api-access`.

If you have an Access Token, you need to set the `Authorization` Header in every secured request to `Bearer your_access_token`.

With this endpoint you can fetch your API Key. If you haven't generated one yet, `null` will be returned.

 You cannot obtain an API Secret in this way, since it’s visible only once right after generation. If you have lost your API Secret, please generate a new pair of API Key & API Secret.

item.name: Generate new API Key & API Secret

request.description:
With this endpoint you can generate a new pair of API Key & API Secret.

Every time you generate a new pair, the old one becomes invalid. Your API Secret won’t be accessible later, so please note it down in some secret place. If you have lost your API Secret, you can generate a new pair of API Key & API Secret here.

item.name: Integrations

request.description: With this endpoint you can list the names of all Integrations you have enabled on [https://product.early.app/](https://product.early.app/)

item.description: Your EARLY account can be connected with Integrations, eg. JIRA. Check them out on [https://product.early.app/#/settings/integrations](https://product.early.app/#/settings/integrations).

item.name: Activities

request.description:
With this endpoint you can create a new Activity. It should have a name and a color.

The name doesn’t have to be unique. You can also provide an Integration to which the a ctivity will belong (zei by default, which means no special Integration). You can obtain a list of enabled Integrations by making a GET request to /api/v1/integrations.

In order to activate your Device, make a POST request to /api/v2/devices/{deviceSerial}/active.

response.name: No Device is Active or Activity is not assigned to given Device Side

Activities are one of the main concepts in EARLY. You can track time on them and synchronize them with third party tools, such as JIRA.

When an activity is no longer needed, you can archive it. The data already tracked on it will remain, even if an activity is archived.

response.name: Device does not have the status Active.

The device represents your Tracker. At the very beginning EARLY knows nothing about your Devices, but you can activate any Device by providing its Serial number.

Only one Device can be active at any given moment, to ensure the EARLY client can perform actions in context of same paired Tracker.

Moreover you can name your Devices to distinguish them easily. Devices can be marked as disabled too, which can help you to see which Devices should not handle Side changes (until enabled again).

The time entry will be created even if it overlaps with other Time Entries – in result existing Time Entries will be split or deleted in such manner, that the new one will fit without overlapping.

item.description: A tracking is the representation of what you are doing at any given moment. When finished, a new Time Entry is created based on the tracked time. All timestamps are in the format 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS' in UTC, eg. '2017-12-31T23:59:59.999'.

item.name: Time Entries
Find Time Entries in given range

request.description: Find Time Entries within the given time range.

response.name: OK

request.description:
With this endpoint you can create a new time entry. It should be connected to an activity and have a duration no shorter than 1 minute. The note can be provided as well, but it’s not required.

You can provide one or more tags and mentions, each of their prefixes must be configured with the start and the end index within the note text and can be defined with a key. If the key is not defined a random id will be generated and assigned. If you are referring to an existing tag or mention you can provide that key but the content of the tag or mention must be the same.
If the related Activity is bound to some Integration, let’s say a JIRA Project, JIRA task IDs are a valid Mention too.

The time entry will be created even if it overlaps with other Time Entries – in result existing time entries will be split or deleted in such manner, that the new one will fit without overlapping.

response.name: Created Time Entry
Integration-related error, eg. if new Time Entry somehow conflicts with data on the Integration side
Found Time Entry

request.description:
With this endpoint you can edit an existing Time Entry. When changing the activity ID please note, that both the new and old activity attached to the time entry have to belong to same Integration.

To remove a note, just set the complete object to null and all values within the object will be deleted too.

response.name: Edited Time Entry
Integration-related error, eg. if given integration does not exist
Activity or Time Entry not found
OK

item.description:
Time Entries are one of the main concepts in EARLY.

They represent time spent on activities. A time entry can contain a textual Note, which allows you to add some useful context.

There can be only one Time Entry in any given time-frame, even if they belong to different activities. All timestamps are in the format 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS' in UTC, eg. '2017-12-31T23:59:59.999'.

request.description:
Generates a report which contains all the Time Entries from inside the given time range. If some Time Entry exceeds the report’s time range, only the matching part will be included.

*Warning: For this endpoint you need a pro subscription!*

There are three optional query parameters:

* activityId (e.g. 1)
* noteQuery (e.g. "sometext")
* fileType ("xlsx" or "csv" - defaults to "csv")

And one mandatory parameter:

* timezone (e.g. Europe/Warsaw)

response.name: Report in CSV or XLSX format

item.name: Tags & Mentions

request.description:
Tags and Mentions are created with the use of an explicit reference within the Notes of your Time Entries / Tracking.

Moreover, if an activity is linked with a third party integration, such as a JIRA project, JIRA task IDs can be used as Mentions.

With this endpoint, you can fetch all your Tags and Mentions.

response.name: List of Tags and Mentions

item.description: Tags and Mentions are a concept for adding contextual information to time entries. You can add #tags and @mentions to a time entry's note.

**WARNING: This is not the latest version of the API. Please use the latest version.**

Welcome to the documentation of EARLY Public API v2.

Most of the endpoints are secured.

In order to access them you have to provide an Access Token. To obtain an Access Token, you have to sign-in with a pair of API Key and API Secret first. API Key & API Secret can be generated on [https://product.early.app](https://product.early.app).

If you have any questions, please visit [https://support.early.app](https://support.early.app).

Happy API browsing!
